snippet: The depths have become a noisy place because of human activity, and experts say the rising clamor is particularly dangerous to marine mammals.
abstract: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration is undertaking project to document human-made noises in Earth's oceans and transform results into world's first large sound maps; project is first phase of what could become large-scale effort to curb noise pollution, which has particularly harmful effect on whales and other marine mammals.
lead_paragraph: The depths have become a noisy place because of human activity, and experts say the rising clamor is particularly dangerous to marine mammals.

headline.seo: Project Seeks to Map and Reduce Ocean Noise Pollution
headline.main: A Rising Tide of Noise Is Now Easy to See
headline.print_headline: A Rising Tide of Noise Is Now Easy to See
